diagnosis.final_diagnosis: severe aortic regurgitation after T. David-I valve-sparing aortic root replacement
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with heart failure symptoms due to severe recurrent aortic regurgitation, confirmed by echocardiography. Previously, a T. David-I procedure had been performed, which later showed mild to moderate aortic regurgitation over time leading to reoperation, during which structural valve deterioration was observed.
